A group of artists, academics, and collectors who wanted to hold an exhibition dedicated to the works of Alice Abu Hamdan—a Palestinian female artist who was one of the first to be included in the UNESCO’s “Art of the Palestinian Century” survey in 1991—have launched a new initiative to raise funds and organize an event that would celebrate the life and work of the artist.The organization that will organize the event is the Palestine Solidarity Fund, a nonprofit organization that works with artists, artists' families, and Palestinian artists to promote their art through their collections and through various programs. The organization is also working with Jordanian artist Nima Nabavi to create an exhibition that will highlight the work of Palestinian female artists.
